The zebrafish model – showing the high consistency in developmental toxicity studies with mammals

21 – seems to be an excellent research tool to determine the embryo(larva)toxicity of anticancer active 8-substituted-3-(trifluoromethyl)-7,8-dihydroimidazo[2,1- c][1,2,4]triazin-4(6 H)-ones. Therefore, in the present study, we investigated – for the first time – the effect of compounds I–VIII and a standard anticancer drug – pemetrexed on the early-life stages (embryos and non-feeding larvae) of Danio rerio in the concentration- and exposure time-dependent manner. To assess the developmental toxicity among embryos and larvae from the compounds-/pemetrexed-treated and control groups, the end-points such as the mortality of larvae, hatching rate of embryos and developmental abnormalities observed at every 24 h post-fertilisation until five days after the exposure to the compounds/pemetrexed were included.
